description: From Middle English upgang, from Old English upgang (“ascent”), equivalent to up- +‎ gang. Cognate with Dutch opgang (“ascent”), German Aufgang (“rising, ascent”), Swedish uppgång (“a rise, a way up”), Icelandic uppgang (“expansion”).

entries.meaning: (UK dialectal) The act of ascending a slope; ascent.
(UK dialectal) A way up; a slope.
(UK dialectal) A sudden rising of wind and sea; a storm.
